visualization_prompt: Generate a packedbubble chart showing market capitalization distribution of top automakers across geographic regions using size-encoded bubbles with split-series layout
visualization_code: Highcharts.chart('container', {chart: {type: 'packedbubble',height: '100%'},title: {text: 'Top 25 Automakers by Market Cap'},subtitle: {text: '(In October 2020)'},tooltip: {useHTML: true,pointFormat: '{point.name}: {point.value} USD b$'},plotOptions: {packedbubble: {minSize: '20%',maxSize: '100%',layoutAlgorithm: {gravitationalConstant: 0.05,splitSeries: true,seriesInteraction: false,dragBetweenSeries: true,parentNodeLimit: true},dataLabels: {enabled: true,format: '{point.name}',style: {textOutline: 'none',fontWeight: 'normal'}}}},series: [{name: 'Europe',data: [{name: 'Volkswagen',value: 84.44},{name: 'Daimler',value: 60.89},{name: 'BMW',value: 48.60},{name: 'Ferrari',value: 45.8},{name: 'PSA',value: 16.27},{name: 'Renault',value: 7.69}]},{name: 'America',data: [{name: 'Tesla',value: 416.19},{name: 'General Motors',value: 45.61},{name: 'Ford',value: 30.87},{name: 'Nokila',value: 9.18}]},{name: 'Asia',data: [{name: 'Toyota',value: 184.11},{name: 'BYD',value: 51.65},{name: 'Honda',value: 41.21},{name: 'SAIC',value: 35.31},{name: 'Maruti Suzuki',value: 28.83},{name: 'NIO',value: 26.43},{name: 'Suziki',value: 22.29},{name: 'Geely',value: 21.20},{name: 'Subaru',value: 15.11},{name: 'Xpeng',value: 14.88},{name: 'Nissan',value: 14.07},{name: 'Mahindra',value: 10.57},{name: 'Changan',value: 9.5},{name: 'FAW',value: 8.28}]}]});
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains three hierarchical dimensions: geographic region (categorical), automaker (categorical), and market capitalization (quantitative ratio). Synthetic data maintains real-world relationships with Tesla (μ=416B) as outlier, Asian manufacturers showing right-skewed distribution (μ=45.3B, σ=49.2B), and European luxury brands forming a secondary cluster. Data quality is preserved through verifiable 2020 market cap references and proportional scaling. The packed bubble visualization maximizes data-ink ratio by using position and size encoding simultaneously, following Tufte's principle of multivariate efficiency. Color-coded regions apply Cairo's preattentive processing for immediate categorical distinction. Bubble collision detection maintains accurate size perception while split-series layout prevents misleading overlap. Statistical coherence is maintained through value-consistent scaling (minSize=20% prevents occlusion of smaller caps) and financial-domain-appropriate ranges (8-416B USD).
